medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute onset right lower quadrant (RLQ) pain and fevers.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient reported feeling 'gassy' the day prior to admission, with RLQ pain starting around 10:30 AM. The pain is described as sharp, focal, and non-radiating, constant and preventing him from sleeping. He has also been experiencing mild nausea, constipation, distension, and fevers to 104 degrees Fahrenheit at home.
medical_history.past_medical_history: GERD, gout (podagra), history of left knee arthroscopy & partial medial meniscectomy.
